newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan bank shares down in Tokyo on renewed selling.
newsitem.headline: Japan bank shares down in Tokyo on renewed selling.

text.p: Shares in Japan's banking sector O#BNK.T weakened in Tokyo on Monday on renewed selling interest after confirming an upside, with Sakura Bank Ltd leading the slippage.
As of 0432 GMT, Sakura was down 24 yen at 747 yen in turnover of 2.68 million shares, the third-largest volume on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
Shares in Sumitomo Bank Ltd were down 50 yen at 1,470.
"The recent recovery (of banking shares) was largely due to buying back. Such buying has petered out and there are no more major buyers," said one Japanese broker.

Brokers also said some companes were selling bank shares in an attempt to dissolve cross-shareholdings -- a practice by which companies hold each others' shares to strengthen business ties -- before closing their books for the financial year to March 31.
